instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beeps as in ram problem
threads.message:
Hi, I have this board beeping 3 times

Voltages on <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>
6= 1,8
12= 5,1
16= 3,3
17=3,2

This board was messed with before, because it had a short on the line <SIGNAL>PPDDR_S3_REG_R</SIGNAL> caused by a bad resoldered ram, I changed the 4 chips, but it is still giving me the 3 beeps...
I messed up a little with the ramcfg resistors but put them back again...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beeps as in ram problem
threads.message: If all chips have good solders, then a bad RAM chip, or CPU.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beeps as in ram problem
threads.message: I reflowed the ram and now it is turning on, but the fan is going hi inmediately, I changed the smc, but made no difference... what sensor makes the fan go high?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beeps as in ram problem
threads.message:
Try first disconnecting webcam.
Next, change trackpad board/flex.
Also try known good RIO board/flex.

Run HWMonitor and check for strange temps reported.
You can make an idea about which bus is affected.

Starting in diagnostic mode, can also display usefull information.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 3 beeps as in ram problem
threads.message: reballed the smc and that did it... thank you for your help!
